title: HERE, NOW, FOREVER
body_text:
It all began on September 3, 2005.
Welcome to
EastCoastDodgeball's
5 Year Anniversary
.
That's right, September 3, 2005, and since that day, the battle between sisters
Valerie
and
Lauren
has traveled the entire distance .. with no clear cut winner!
EastCoastDodgeball's
"5 Year Anniversary" was the obvious event choice to finally settle this war once and for all.
As if to duplicate the series of matches, "ValPal" grabbed the opening round after a grueling, hour-long war. After a brief intermission, Justin "Punter" Wolf, Eamon Fitzpatrick, and newly-inducted
ECDElitist
Mike "Sputz" gained the second contest as well, giving the eldest Winston the comfortable 2 to 0 advantage.
Game 3 was crucial for Lauren, and her supporting cast knew it, failing to throw in the towel.
ECDElitist
Justin Pierce, along with rim-smacking Stopa and "Crazy One" Edwards, revived Team LAUREN enough to snatch a victory. Clearly the momentum had shifted when, in a tremendous 4th round, the younger sibling tied the historical match at 2. With time quickly winding down, the finale would ultimately determine the "Winston Cup" champi... ... ??
A mere three combatants surviving for Captain Valerie kept the most storied family feud unresolved because at 9:11pm exactly, the battleground lights shut off! Looks like the sisters aren't finished just yet - "6 Year Anniversary" perhaps?
EastCoastDoodgeball
will just have to wait.
More, More ..
Unquestionably one the sport's most memorable extravaganzas yielded plenty of big-time moments and standout stars. For starters,
Tom Adams'
three-minute "last man standing" Game 2 performance - completely barefoot mind you - may have been the show-stealer.
Darrell Tronolone's
NFL Raiders sandals didn't stall him in hurling weapons, dodging with ease, and miraculously catching with his ankles either; not bad for 50-plus!
PondScum's
Turner
and
Marzarella
proved durability and longevity excellence in each of the four rounds. The Yochum-crafted rims certainly took a beating, especially when
ECDElitists
Kevin Fitzpatrick
nearly cracked them in half.
Joanie Lima's
sideline eliminations, newbie
Andrew Capaci's
impressive grabs, the numbing faceshot perpetrated against an out-of-bounds
Chris Pedraza
, and the crowd-pleasing, clap-happy "I Gotta Feeling" by the Black Eyed Peas soundtrack hit will long be remembered.
.. and More!
ECD
praises the following audience members! Special thanks to The Spengeman Family, Nancy "Grandma" Tronolone, The Pierce Family, The Fitzpatrick Family, Ms. Gail Adams and Aunt Cicely, The Krott Family, as well as Diana DiBuccio's coworkers Kathleen McGreevy and Wendy Ramas for coming out in support of this once-in-a-lifetime spectacular.
"... The reason why dodgeball continued every week ..." couldn't have been a more fitting or accurate statement. Seven of the most physically dominating, creatively instrumental, socially influential, and longtime contributing individuals were inducted into the prestigious
ECDElite
Hall of Fame
. Each inaugural class member had their enviable list of accomplishments read aloud and were awarded a personalized medal in front of a jam-packed crowd comprised of friends, family, and peers. Only at
ECD's
5th birthday party could such recognition be witnessed.
Michael "Sputz" Krott
Background Information
: Debut D-DAY 5; 139 events participated | 82.2%; right-handed
Career Highlights
: 2x season finale headliner; 2x
Rimshot Contest
winner
Awards
: "Player of the Year" finalist (2008); "Hot Hands Catcher", "Act of Courage", "Terminator" (2006)
Contributions
: innovator of
GodMode Rules
; created on-court posters for various events; helped set-up and decorate for major outings.
Christopher Adams
Background Information
: Debut DODGEBALL DAY 3; 146 events participated | 85.3%; right-handed
Career Highlights
: 3x season finale headliner; 2x mid-season main eventer; 2x
Rimshot Contest
winner
[first-ever]
;
Championship Chase
winner
Awards
: "Rivalry of the Year" finalist
[vs. K. Fitzpatrick]
(2007); "King and Queen"
[with L. Freda]
, "Best Dressed" (2006); "Powerhouse Thrower" (2005)
Contributions
: innovator of
BoxBall Dodgeball
and
SuperMario Dodgeball
; participated in
CREAMation 3
; put together several musical soundtracks; major contributing factor in 2009.
Kevin Fitzpatrick
Background Information
: Debut DODGEBALL XTWO; 130 events participated | 80.2%; right-handed
Career Highlights
: 2x season finale headliner; 2x mid-season main eventer; 4x
Battle Royal
winner
[second all-time]
Awards
: "Rivalry of the Year" finalist
[vs. C. Adams]
(2007); "Act of Courage" (2006); "Powerhouse Thrower" (2005)
Contributions
: participated in
CREAMation 3
; brought radio, iPod, table, and/or air compressor to countless events.
Diana DiBuccio
Background Information
: Debut DODGEBALL DAY 1; 165 events participated | 95.3%; right-handed
Career Highlights
: season finale headliner; anniversary event headliner;
Battle Royal
winner
[only woman ever]
;
Rimshot Contest
winner; 4th 2006
Captains Champion
Awards
: "Comedian of the Year" finalist (2008); "Act of Courage", "Appreciation" (2006); "Perfect Attendance", "Rivalry of the Year"
[vs. J. Pierce]
(2005)
Contributions
: hosted "PastaParty" on the eve of DODGEBALL XXV; participated in
CREAMation 2
; put together several musical soundtracks; helped set-up and decorate for major outings; arrived early to reserve courts.
Justin Pierce
Background Information
: Debut DODGEBALL DAY 2; 134 events participated | 77.9%; right-handed
Career Highlights
: 2x season finale headliner; volunteer
Hit The Human Contest
victim
Awards
: "Painball Powerhouse Thrower", "Appreciation", "Trash Talking" (2006); "Rivalry of the Year"
[vs. D. DiBuccio]
(2005)
Contributions
: created various promotional posters; participated in
CREAMation 2
; helped set-up and decorate for major outings; purchased many dodgeballs.
Kevin Megill Jr.
Background Information
: Debut DODGEBALL DAY 2; 141 events participated | 81.9%; left-handed
Career Highlights
: 3x season finale headliner; mid-season main eventer
Awards
: "Rivalry of the Year" finalist
[vs. M. Edwards]
(2007); "Powerhouse Thrower", "Appreciation", "Best Dressed", "Deflection Defense" (2006)
Contributions
: purchased sports bag, pump, and many dodgeballs.
Kevin Adams
Background Information
: Debut D-DAY 5; 141 events participated | 83.4%; right-handed
Career Highlights
: 3x season finale headliner; mid-season main eventer; 6th 2006
Captains Champion
Awards
: "Player of the Year" (2007); "Appreciation" (2006); "Act of Courage" (2005)
Contributions
: participated in
CREAMation 1
; helped set-up and decorate for major outings; arrived early to reserve courts.
Once again, congratulations are certainly in order to each of these "Elitist" for their half-decade-long dedication, effort, and commitment. If you missed the
ECDElite
Induction Ceremony, you can catch it below as filmed by legendary female titan Valerie Winston.
*Attendance figures and percentages exclude the "5 Year Anniversary".
Attendance
: 41, comprised of 31 men and 10 women. This was the 6th largest attendance in
ECD
history. Notable events with greater turnouts include DODGEBALL 100, DODGEBALL 150, and DODGEBALL 50.
New Dodgeballers
: (11) Andrew Capaci, Angelique Ramos, Brian Carlsen, Brittney Ramos, Chris Pedraza, Dan Farnkopf, Dave D'Agostino, Gerard Dunn, Kenny Jacobs, Kris Librizzi, Ryan Boyle. According to
Tronolone Era
statistics, this was the highest turnout of new players since May 2008.
Game Rules
: Classic two-team.
Featured Match
: Valerie Winston fought Lauren Winston to a 2-2 draw. This was the record-breaking fifth time the pair of sisters - or any two captains - met head-to-head.
Game-By-Game Results
: Valerie 1, 2; Lauren 3, 4. The game-by-game conclusions completely mirrored that of their series rivalry - Val won the first two matches, Lauren the third and fourth.
Captains Records
: Valerie 3-5-2; Lauren 4-5-2
Soundtrack
: John Tronolone
Theme Song
: "Right Here, Right Now" by Fatboy Slim
Online Exclusive!
"5 Year Anniversary" was the 175th event produced within the
Tronolone Era
.
ECD "5 Year Anniversary" .. what did you think?
10. I'll tell my own kids one day.
9.
8.
7.
6.
5.
4.
3.
2.
1. Likely to be a bad parent.
pollcode.com
free polls
________________________________________
___________________________
Next Event
"The Writer" doesn't want to give too much away. Let's just say there has never been a 10th of these - keep
October 16
clear!
body_html:
It all began on September 3, 2005.
Welcome to EastCoastDodgeball's 5 Year Anniversary.

That's right, September 3, 2005, and since that day, the battle between sisters Valerie and Lauren has traveled the entire distance .. with no clear cut winner! EastCoastDodgeball's "5 Year Anniversary" was the obvious event choice to finally settle this war once and for all.

As if to duplicate the series of matches, "ValPal" grabbed the opening round after a grueling, hour-long war. After a brief intermission, Justin "Punter" Wolf, Eamon Fitzpatrick, and newly-inducted ECDElitist Mike "Sputz" gained the second contest as well, giving the eldest Winston the comfortable 2 to 0 advantage.

Game 3 was crucial for Lauren, and her supporting cast knew it, failing to throw in the towel. ECDElitist Justin Pierce, along with rim-smacking Stopa and "Crazy One" Edwards, revived Team LAUREN enough to snatch a victory. Clearly the momentum had shifted when, in a tremendous 4th round, the younger sibling tied the historical match at 2. With time quickly winding down, the finale would ultimately determine the "Winston Cup" champi... ... ??

A mere three combatants surviving for Captain Valerie kept the most storied family feud unresolved because at 9:11pm exactly, the battleground lights shut off! Looks like the sisters aren't finished just yet - "6 Year Anniversary" perhaps? EastCoastDoodgeball will just have to wait.

More, More ..
Unquestionably one the sport's most memorable extravaganzas yielded plenty of big-time moments and standout stars. For starters, Tom Adams' three-minute "last man standing" Game 2 performance - completely barefoot mind you - may have been the show-stealer. Darrell Tronolone's NFL Raiders sandals didn't stall him in hurling weapons, dodging with ease, and miraculously catching with his ankles either; not bad for 50-plus!

PondScum's Turner and Marzarella proved durability and longevity excellence in each of the four rounds. The Yochum-crafted rims certainly took a beating, especially when ECDElitists Kevin Fitzpatrick nearly cracked them in half. Joanie Lima's sideline eliminations, newbie Andrew Capaci's impressive grabs, the numbing faceshot perpetrated against an out-of-bounds Chris Pedraza, and the crowd-pleasing, clap-happy "I Gotta Feeling" by the Black Eyed Peas soundtrack hit will long be remembered.

.. and More!
ECD praises the following audience members! Special thanks to The Spengeman Family, Nancy "Grandma" Tronolone, The Pierce Family, The Fitzpatrick Family, Ms. Gail Adams and Aunt Cicely, The Krott Family, as well as Diana DiBuccio's coworkers Kathleen McGreevy and Wendy Ramas for coming out in support of this once-in-a-lifetime spectacular.


"... The reason why dodgeball continued every week ..." couldn't have been a more fitting or accurate statement. Seven of the most physically dominating, creatively instrumental, socially influential, and longtime contributing individuals were inducted into the prestigious ECDElite Hall of Fame. Each inaugural class member had their enviable list of accomplishments read aloud and were awarded a personalized medal in front of a jam-packed crowd comprised of friends, family, and peers. Only at ECD's 5th birthday party could such recognition be witnessed.

Michael "Sputz" Krott
  • Background Information: Debut D-DAY 5; 139 events participated | 82.2%; right-handed
  • Career Highlights: 2x season finale headliner; 2x Rimshot Contest winner
  • Awards: "Player of the Year" finalist (2008); "Hot Hands Catcher", "Act of Courage", "Terminator" (2006)
  • Contributions: innovator of GodMode Rules; created on-court posters for various events; helped set-up and decorate for major outings.

    Christopher Adams
  • Background Information: Debut DODGEBALL DAY 3; 146 events participated | 85.3%; right-handed
  • Career Highlights: 3x season finale headliner; 2x mid-season main eventer; 2x Rimshot Contest winner [first-ever]; Championship Chase winner
  • Awards: "Rivalry of the Year" finalist [vs. K. Fitzpatrick] (2007); "King and Queen" [with L. Freda], "Best Dressed" (2006); "Powerhouse Thrower" (2005)
  • Contributions: innovator of BoxBall Dodgeball and SuperMario Dodgeball; participated in CREAMation 3; put together several musical soundtracks; major contributing factor in 2009.

    Kevin Fitzpatrick
  • Background Information: Debut DODGEBALL XTWO; 130 events participated | 80.2%; right-handed
  • Career Highlights: 2x season finale headliner; 2x mid-season main eventer; 4x Battle Royal winner [second all-time]
  • Awards: "Rivalry of the Year" finalist [vs. C. Adams] (2007); "Act of Courage" (2006); "Powerhouse Thrower" (2005)
  • Contributions: participated in CREAMation 3; brought radio, iPod, table, and/or air compressor to countless events.

    Diana DiBuccio
  • Background Information: Debut DODGEBALL DAY 1; 165 events participated | 95.3%; right-handed
  • Career Highlights: season finale headliner; anniversary event headliner; Battle Royal winner [only woman ever]; Rimshot Contest winner; 4th 2006 Captains Champion
  • Awards: "Comedian of the Year" finalist (2008); "Act of Courage", "Appreciation" (2006); "Perfect Attendance", "Rivalry of the Year" [vs. J. Pierce] (2005)
  • Contributions: hosted "PastaParty" on the eve of DODGEBALL XXV; participated in CREAMation 2; put together several musical soundtracks; helped set-up and decorate for major outings; arrived early to reserve courts.

    Justin Pierce
  • Background Information: Debut DODGEBALL DAY 2; 134 events participated | 77.9%; right-handed
  • Career Highlights: 2x season finale headliner; volunteer Hit The Human Contest victim
  • Awards: "Painball Powerhouse Thrower", "Appreciation", "Trash Talking" (2006); "Rivalry of the Year" [vs. D. DiBuccio] (2005)
  • Contributions: created various promotional posters; participated in CREAMation 2; helped set-up and decorate for major outings; purchased many dodgeballs.

    Kevin Megill Jr.
  • Background Information: Debut DODGEBALL DAY 2; 141 events participated | 81.9%; left-handed
  • Career Highlights: 3x season finale headliner; mid-season main eventer
  • Awards: "Rivalry of the Year" finalist [vs. M. Edwards] (2007); "Powerhouse Thrower", "Appreciation", "Best Dressed", "Deflection Defense" (2006)
  • Contributions: purchased sports bag, pump, and many dodgeballs.

    Kevin Adams
  • Background Information: Debut D-DAY 5; 141 events participated | 83.4%; right-handed
  • Career Highlights: 3x season finale headliner; mid-season main eventer; 6th 2006 Captains Champion
  • Awards: "Player of the Year" (2007); "Appreciation" (2006); "Act of Courage" (2005)
  • Contributions: participated in CREAMation 1; helped set-up and decorate for major outings; arrived early to reserve courts.

    Once again, congratulations are certainly in order to each of these "Elitist" for their half-decade-long dedication, effort, and commitment. If you missed the ECDElite Induction Ceremony, you can catch it below as filmed by legendary female titan Valerie Winston.

    *Attendance figures and percentages exclude the "5 Year Anniversary".




    Attendance: 41, comprised of 31 men and 10 women. This was the 6th largest attendance in ECD history. Notable events with greater turnouts include DODGEBALL 100, DODGEBALL 150, and DODGEBALL 50.
    New Dodgeballers: (11) Andrew Capaci, Angelique Ramos, Brian Carlsen, Brittney Ramos, Chris Pedraza, Dan Farnkopf, Dave D'Agostino, Gerard Dunn, Kenny Jacobs, Kris Librizzi, Ryan Boyle. According to Tronolone Era statistics, this was the highest turnout of new players since May 2008.

    Game Rules: Classic two-team.
    Featured Match: Valerie Winston fought Lauren Winston to a 2-2 draw. This was the record-breaking fifth time the pair of sisters - or any two captains - met head-to-head.
    Game-By-Game Results: Valerie 1, 2; Lauren 3, 4. The game-by-game conclusions completely mirrored that of their series rivalry - Val won the first two matches, Lauren the third and fourth.
    Captains Records: Valerie 3-5-2; Lauren 4-5-2

    Soundtrack: John Tronolone
    Theme Song: "Right Here, Right Now" by Fatboy Slim

    Online Exclusive!
    "5 Year Anniversary" was the 175th event produced within the Tronolone Era.

    ECD "5 Year Anniversary" .. what did you think?
    10. I'll tell my own kids one day.
    9.
    8.
    7.
    6.
    5.
    4.
    3.
    2.
    1. Likely to be a bad parent.
